poem:
Title: "Contrast of Ideologies"

Battlegrounds ripe with 
Intention, the money flows,
painting contrasts stark.
Tied to the past, or 
embracing the new?
Arizona, Michigan, others align.
In the hushed language 
of campaigns,
The Red, The Blue, vie/
Rooted in difference,
Targeted, the trumpet of democracy rings.
Critical resources - an elegy
To a system fraught,
but still blooming.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Democrats target statehouse races in first big campaign spend of 2024 Democrats are targeting seven battlegrounds in their first campaign spend of the year on state legislature elections, the Guardian has learned, and intend to draw “clear contrasts” with Republican candidates tied to former US president Donald Trump. The latest round of investments will deliver “critical resources” to Arizona, Michigan, Minnesota, New Hampshire, North Carolina, Pennsylvania and Wisconsin, the Democratic Legislative Campaign Committee (DLCC) said.". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
